_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Brushy Creek Mine and Mill is part of The Doe Run CompanyA?s Southeast Missouri Mining & Milling Organization (SEMO).  The regulated substance used at this facility is anhydrous (water-free) sulfur dioxide.  It is delivered to the mill via a tanker truck and stored as a liquid under pressure in a horizontal carbon steel tank.  The tank has a maximum capacity of 96,000 pounds SO2.  Tank volume is typically maintained at less than 75% capacity, 72,000 lb

Sulfur dioxide is used in the benefication of copper-bearing ore. Sulfur dioxide vapor is fed to the A?copper circuitA? at a rate controlled to maintain an acceptable pH of process solutions. This aids the separation of copper bearing material from the other components of the solution. Sulfur dioxide is used because it is the most effective and cost-efficient reagent for this purpose.  

Certain safety precautions must be observed when handling and storing sulfur dioxide to prevent human exposure, to reduce the threat to our own personal health as well as our co-workers, to reduce the hazard to nearby members of the surrounding communities, and to reduce the threat to the environment. It is our policy to adhere to all applicable Federal, state and local rules and regulations. 


Access to the mill facilities is restricted to authorized company employees and authorized contractors, and visitors.

There have been no sulfur dioxide accidents or incidents with adverse onsite or offsite consequences.  

The Doe Run Company maintains a strong corporate commitment to employee safety. Safety is part of our culture. All Doe Run facilities consistently operate at safety performance levels better than the industry average. Our commitment to safety extends to safety in the communities in which we operate, and we have implemented education programs that help keep residents safe at home.

Employee training, both formal and informal, and facility maintenance activities are conducted routinely.

The facility has recently updated

its emergency response plan.  This plan addresses: Potential Health Effects; Notifications of Regulatory Agencies, Emergency Responders, the Public, and Doe Run Personnel; Emergency Medical Treatment; Emergency Response, Minor Leak A? Odor and Impact at Leak Site Only, Major Release A? Visible Emission or Liquid Pool Formation, and Off-Site Impact Release A? Visible or High Odor Emission Traveling Off-Site; Emergency Response Equipment Inspection, Testing, and Maintenance; Training; and Local Plan Coordination.

The facility removes, inspects, and repairs pressure relief devices on a scheduled basis to ensure reliable operation if needed.  It is revising itA?s inspection and maintenance programs to demonstrate that process controls and monitoring devices will function as required when needed.  The facility has not had a condition in which automatic safety devices or control function was required.
